Posts.Content: Mine came back as soon as my treatment finished. Fortunately it was a local recurrence. I had a Mastectomy and another year of herceptin. I have been cancer free for 2 years now although I have a 50% chance of it returning. I love my life and have taken up new hobbies. It's a worrying time for you but hold on in there. Sending hugs xx
Posts.Title: re occurance

Posts.Content: I will be certainly asking for my pathology report. Thank you for sharing this advice.
Posts.Title: Wrong cancer entered on my file

Posts.Content: Fingers crossed for tomorrows ultrasound scan. GP referred me in the end. Hopefully these lumps are nothing to worry about.
Posts.Title: Confused??????

Posts.Content: I am having such a panic attack. I feel as if I've been here before. The nipple on my affected side was bleeding and My consultant examined it and in his opinion it was eczema. He recommended E45 cream. 4 months later he performed a biopsy and there were 2 small tumours. How can anyone know just by feeling. I have grade 3 HER2 + breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Confused??????

Posts.Content: In 2010 I had Wide local excision + axillary node clearance. Unfortunately I had a recurrence and then a Mastectomy. I can feel lumps in the axillary tail and under my affected arm pit. My oncologist opinion is the lumps have the features of reactive lymph nodes other than mastastasis. I am confused and worried. Do nodes grow back?
Posts.Title: Confused??????

Posts.Content: I have learned that no question is a silly question. Keep asking the professionals and never feel foolish. It is your body and you need to raise all of your concerns. Good luck and keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Lymphodema question

Posts.Content: Last year I felt well enough to restart my fostering career. During the fostering assessment period I had local recurrence. The agency contacted my oncologist for a prognosis of which ,silly me, I asked for a copy. It read "Her initial prognosis (2010) was to give her an estimated five year survival approximately 50%, but unfortunately on Feb 2013Â  she developed a breast recurrence. She is grade 3 ER neg,PR neg, HER2 pos invasive ductal cancer. Obviously her prognosis now is consequently worse" I have been confused and worried and quite angry really. I wasn't given a prognosis at the beginning. Is this statistical jargon? It stopped my career of 19 years now I feel as if I have no future.
Posts.Title: What does prognosis mean?

Posts.Content: Thanks for this. I realistically know its statistical but it has cast a cloud over my future as my 19 year fostering career ends when my YP reaches 18yrs next year. I adopted a little girl and she is only 9 years and I plan to be there for her until adulthood. I am scared to be honest and sometimes fall into the trap of doom and gloom, it's going to be hard to start a new career at 56. Do other employers ask for this level of health information? I thought I may have been protected by disability act?
Posts.Title: What does prognosis mean?
